alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Candler; Effingham; Jenkins; Screven (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 5:31PM EDT until August 30 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR BULLOCH, CANDLER, EFFINGHAM, JENKINS, SCREVEN, ALLENDALE, HAMPTON AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated extremely heavy rainfall associated with Hurricane Idalia. As much as 4 to 6 inches of rain has fallen so far today. The risk for flash flooding will continue to increase as the center of Idalia moves across Southeast Georgia. Spotters and HAM radio operators recently submittted photos showing water about to enter homes along Northlake Drive and Westlake Drive in Statesboro. Flash flooding is likely across much of the warned area. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Statesboro, Metter, Sylvania, Hampton, Lake Warren State Park, Varnville, Estill, Fairfax, Brooklet, Portal, Brunson, Gifford, Newington, Oliver, Furman, Scotia, Rocky Ford, Luray, Hunters and Captolo. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
